This must be the change we can all believe in - "HOWARD DEAN: The only problem is -- and this is initially going to seem like heresy from a progressive is -- the truth is everybody needs to pay more taxes, not just the rich. And it's a good start. But we're not going to get out of this deficit problem unless we raise taxes across the board, to go back to what Bill Clinton had and his taxes. And if we don't do that, the problem is the pressure is going to be on spending even more."

Topic.Title: A Message To My Fellow Obama Supporters

Message.Msg: Simply stated, the certificate he released should never have had multiple layers if it had been scanned using a computer and converted to .pdf format, unless it had been altered, which it had been altered. And as everyone knows, an altered document cannot be validated as original and an original document or a straight copy of an unaltered document is what he should have released.

Topic.Title: A Message To My Fellow Obama Supporters

Message.Msg: It follows that if – as here – there are multiple irregularities in a document, most of which possess low probabilities of innocent occurrence, the probability that the document is genuine must be vanishingly small In my experience, I have never found a document which, when this probabilistic technique is applied, is determined to be so very nearly certain to be a forgery as the White House document. This pretty much bottom lines Obama's birth certificate is a fake, just like he is.
Able to change color as needed.

Message.Title: BA spacecraft launched
Message.Msg: c 11 (Reuters) - An unmanned Atlas 5 rocket carrying a small robotic space shuttle lifted off from Cape Canaveral Air Force Station in Florida on Tuesday for the third flight in a classified military test program. The 196-foot (60-meter) rocket blasted off at 1:03 p.m. ET (1603 GMT) carrying the military's original X-37B experimental space plane, also known as an Orbital Test Vehicle, or OTV. The unmanned, reusable space shuttle, one of two operated by the U.S. Air Force, spent 224 days circling Earth during its debut mission in 2010. A sister ship blasted off in 2011 and landed itself after 469 days in space, completing the second orbital test flight. The military is not saying how long the third X-37B mission will last, nor what the vehicle will be doing in orbit.

Topic.Title: SPEEA UNION said..." there is a very high chance of a strike" with Boeing

Message.Msg: Dear D-bag, It is not my job, nor that of my peers, to take a big cut in pay and benefits because Boeing's execs screwed up the 787's development program and it is over-budget as a result. Put the blame where it belongs you id-iot stick.

The biggest problem with unions is the membership- Democracy is hard work. Apathy rules. For example, in Michigan- those same people who are like sheep following union bosses are complaining about their so called rights. But look at just the last 4 months or so of how many of their union buddies are ripping them off ( and got caught ) On November 19, 2012, in the United States District Court for the Eastern District of Michigan, Alan Grayewski, former Chairperson of Utility Workers Local 223 – Office, Professional & Technical Division (located in Dearborn, Mich.), was sentenced to one year of probation and was ordered to pay $9,794.76 in restitution and a $25 special assessment. On August 24, 2012, Grayewski pled guilty to one count of failing to maintain union records, in violation of 29 U.S.C. 439(a). The sentencing follows an investigation by the OLMS Detroit District Office. On November 14, 2012, in the United States District Court for the Eastern District of Michigan, James Killingsworth and Billie Jo Killingsworth, former President and former Treasurer, respectively, of Communications Workers of America (CWA) Local 84555 (located in Webberville, Mich.), were each charged in a one-count information with aiding and abetting each other in embezzling $19,197.02 in union funds by making unauthorized ATM and cash withdrawals from the union’s bank account and using the money for their personal expenses, in violation of 29 U.S.C. 501(c) and 18 U.S.C. 2. The charges follow an investigation by the OLMS Detroit District Office. On October 10, 2012, in the Third Judicial Circuit Court of Wayne County, Michigan, Richard Ikerd, former Secretary-Treasurer of American Federation of State, County and Municipal Employees (AFSCME) Local 2568 (located in Melvindale, Mich.), pled guilty to one count of embezzlement of $1,000 or more but less than $20,000. On July 9, 2012, a complaint was filed charging Ikerd with the same crime. The sentencing is scheduled for January 22, 2013. The guilty plea follows an investigation by the OLMS Detroit District Office. On October 3, 2012, in the United States District Court for the Eastern District of Michigan, Joya Mills, former Financial Secretary of United Auto Workers (UAW) Local 2500 (located in Detroit, Mich.), pled guilty to one count of failure to maintain union records, in violation of 29 U.S.C. 439(a). On September 20, 2011, Mills was charged with the same offense. The plea follows an investigation by the OLMS Detroit District Office. On September 20, 2012, in the United States District Court for the Western District of Michigan (Northern Division), Renita Dompier, former Secretary-Treasurer of Machinists Local Lodge 283 (located in Baraga, Mich.), was sentenced to one year of probation including six months of home detention with electronic monitoring. Dompier was also ordered to pay $11,793.89 in restitution and a $100 special assessment. On May 10, 2012, Dompier pled guilty to one count of embezzling union funds in the amount of $8,725.99, in violation of 29 U.S.C. 501(c). The sentencing follows an investigation by the OLMS Detroit District Office. On September 4, 2012, in the United States District Court of the Western District of Missouri, Michael Palmer, former President of American Federation of State, County and Municipal Employees (AFCSME) Local 1379 (located in Fulton, Mo.), was sentenced to 120 days of confinement, three years of probation, and was ordered to pay restitution of $1,931 and a $200 fine. On April 4, 2012, Palmer pled guilty to one count of bank fraud, in violation of 18 U.S.C. 1344. The sentencing follows an investigation by the OLMS St. Louis District Office. On August 14, 2012, in the Berrien County, Michigan Circuit Court, a criminal complaint was filed charging Linda Caldwell, former Financial Secretary of United Auto Workers (UAW) Local 383 (located in Benton Harbor, Mich.), with one count of embezzlement from a non-profit organization of $200 or more but less than $1,000. The charge follows an investigation by the OLMS Detroit District Office. On August 10, 2012, in the United States District Court for the Eastern District of Michigan, Paul Morales, former Treasurer of United Transportation Union (UTU) Local 1477 (located in Taylor, Mich.), was sentenced to three years of probation (including the completion of 15 hours per week of community service for the first year of probation) and was ordered to pay $25,329.39 in restitution and a $25 special assessment. On April 18, 2012, Morales pled guilty to one count of willfully failing to maintain union records of unauthorized cash withdrawals totaling $22,829.39, in violation of 29 U.S.C. 439(a). The sentencing follows an investigation by the OLMS Detroit District Office.

SPEEA was not allowed to design nor IAM to build the 787, however both organizations were ordered by the Boeing Executives to go all over the world and fix the contractors faulty design and sub par parts. But Boeing Executives under the rule of MD went with the same busniess plan that bankrupted MD"In Hart-Smith's analysis, the seeds of Boeing's outsourcing ideas grew out of the McDonnell aircraft business, which focused on military-airplane programs. On the military side of the business, the U.S. government was the major, often the only, customer and it funded development costs in full. "The military approach didn't require you to risk your own money," Hart-Smith said. "That was the McDonnell Douglas mentality." He blamed that attitude for the major outsourcing on the MD-95 and proposed MD-12 programs, the failure of which led to the decline of Douglas' commercial-airplane business in California. The same ideas were transferred to Boeing with the McDonnell Douglas merger and led directly to the 787 outsourcing strategy, he said. Taken to its extreme conclusion, Hart-Smith said mockingly, the strategy of maximizing return on net assets could lead Boeing to outsource everything except a little Boeing decal to slap on the nose of the finished airplane. Though most of the profits would be outsourced to suppliers along with all the work, and all the company's expertise would wither away phantom field, the nonsense that comes from your user comment is guided by your egregious lack of knowledge in the sphere of true learnedness about Boeing or union activities , not to mention engineering, Boeing and MD. Message.Title: phantomfield wish that you guys read Strauss on 787 costs, der?
Message.Msg: phantomfield, made a comment on my post about the time out between the SPEEA union and Boeing , blaming the costs ont he Boeing workers. It needs to be set straight. phantomfield used a article by a analyst , Strauss to claim that Boeing wages were the cause of the 787 program being excessivley costly to build. the only correct item in phantomfield report is the costs, which he does not mention, the Boeing 787 program is 3 years late and over 30 billion so far in exessive costs.. So that alone should tell any reader that the Boeing workforce did not cause that kind of cost over run, it they could they would all be retired and multimillionaires now. So lets read on about the article that Strauss was quoted and make some sense out of phantomfield's planted statment, if you read the entire article then you get to the truth. . "Mr. Strauss estimated that Boeing was recently spending $232 million to build each plane but charged customers, on average, only about half that." Given Wall Street’s concerns, Boeing’s stock has been in limbo for more than three years, trading in a narrow range , der! Boeing has acknowledged that it outsourced too much of the( engineering) work on the plane to suppliers who were willing, collectively, to cover billions of dollars of the development costs. Many parts needed reworking.( IAM) That and other design changes forced the company engineers , after the contractors screwed it up, and had to be redone by the Boeing engineers, located in Everett. next the IAM assemblers had to fix and work with the engineers ., to handle the rework of faulty parts, designed and built by the outsourced companies, and do complete reworkon the first 65 jets. ..."to fix the outsourcing mistakes made by Boeing Executives" . Finally , Boeing was warned about using the MD business plan and ignored the MD bankruptcy business plan,( DC-10 it is not a failure of Boeing workers, it is a failure of contractor workers). And the cause of the cost and late to the market is outsourcing the design and build process, the charges can not go to the contractors as they are independent and only make profit but Boeing eats the loss. This is covered in teh Hart-Smith report by a senior Boeing engineer. Nothing overbudget costs is due the Boeing SPEEA or IAM on the 787, all over budget costs are due excessive rework caused by planning errors on Boeing managment. Remember Boeing outsorced the engineering and the build of the parts so there was no budget for most of the 787 in theory charged to Boeing workers. It only came to them after Boeing managment needed Boeing workers to fix their screwed up business plan.

Topic.Title: funny Americans want these handouts but this deficit is going to throw the country into

Message.Title: 787 costs the source , not the excuse
Message.Msg: In Hart-Smith's analysis, the seeds of Boeing's outsourcing ideas grew out of the McDonnell aircraft business, which focused on military-airplane programs. On the military side of the business, the U.S. government was the major, often the only, customer and it funded development costs in full. "The military approach didn't require you to risk your own money," Hart-Smith said. "That was the McDonnell Douglas mentality." He blamed that attitude for the major outsourcing on the MD-95 and proposed MD-12 programs, the failure of which led to the decline of Douglas' commercial-airplane business in California. The same ideas were transferred to Boeing with the McDonnell Douglas merger and led directly to the 787 outsourcing strategy, he said. Taken to its extreme conclusion, Hart-Smith said , the strategy of maximizing return on net assets could lead Boeing to outsource everything except a Boeing decal to slap on the nose of the outsourced airplane. Though most of the profits would be outsourced to suppliers along with all the work, and all the company's expertise would wither away. Finally all the risks would be held by the Boeing Company and any outsourced design or parts made wrong would still be the cost and responsibility of the Boeing shareholders. The only pay and benefits not tied toBoeing costs of production are the executive salary and retirement plans . any company that pays it's executives first should not be one held by any shareholder

Mr Strauss goes on to state that the costs , spending 232 million to build each 787 and selling the 787 for about half that amount is due to outsourced engineering and parts making and nothing is mentioned about Boeing workers both union and non union , nor engineers or blue collar workers. The concern of Mr Strauss is that the business plan was flawed , the same point made by Boeing own engineering recomendation. Boeing engineers bid 5 billion to build a 787 like the 777 and about 100 years of past success, if allowed there is little reason to doubt the jobw would have been done on time and budget. The problem is the leadership is attempting to emulate companies that do not require long periods of time to develop specific engineering skills realted to real life building of airplanes or making parts that work. This was what worked until the last Boeing designed and built plane the 777.

Topic.Title: CSU Researchers Say Sandy Wasn’t Influenced By Global Warming

Message.Msg: I read peer reviewed science. Let me help educate you because your anecdotal beliefs are not supported by science. Abstract of paper: Tropical cyclone accumulated cyclone energy (ACE) has exhibited strikingly large global interannual variability during the past 40‐years. In the pentad since 2006, Northern Hemisphere and global tropical cyclone ACE has decreased dramatically to the lowest levels since the late 1970s. Additionally, the global frequency of tropical cyclones has reached a historical low. Here evidence is presented demonstrating that considerable variability in tropical cyclone ACE is associated with the evolution of the character of observed large‐scale climate mechanisms including the El Niño Southern Oscillation and Pacific Decadal Oscillation. In contrast to record quiet North Pacific tropical cyclone activity in 2010, the North Atlantic basin remained very active by contributing almost one‐third of the overall calendar year global ACE. Citation: Maue, R. N. (2011), Recent historically low global tropical cyclone activity, Geophys. Res. Lett., 38, LXXXXX, doi:10.1029/2011GL047711. In case you missed it, "Additionally, the global frequency of tropical cyclones has reached a historical low."
Now that is a problem in and of itself. When one claims to be a Boeing Engineer for 22 years and does not know the company has standards. No wonder my first post in this thread rings true.

Just like 12 years ago, it isn't about the money. The engineers are burnt out from fixing problems upper management created years ago against the advice of the engineers and many lower level managers. Upper management then gave themselves promotions and big fat raises.

Topic.Title: Mediator hits pause button between BA and SPEEA

Message.Msg: The answer is that most people/press/members believe that the title of Executive director ALWAYS confers administrative authority and responsibility. And that title is typical of NON profit organizations - BUT assumptions make an a*** of U and ME if you recall. A detailed discussion is out of scope here , but I will provide a thumbnail IF any member is interested, they should contact the Governing Documents Committee and request a review with the aim of changing the title to more accurately define the Office Manager and Eliminate the title of ED completely. 1) Most unions do NOT have a position of Executive Director 2) Most non profit corporations do use the term for different reasons 3) The title of ED has been routinely abused for decades at SPEEA whether thru apathy, incompetence, or simply not paying attention to the federal rules. Most of the E-boards over several decades never saw the 990 before or after it was filed. The previous legal staff refused to provide a 990 at my request- it took a letter to the IRS to correct that. For decades, (until about 2004), the ED signed form 990. Per the IRS, unless there was specific authority granted in the Gov Docs, that was a major NO – NO I was instrumental in getting that fiasco changed- resolved , so now it is SPEEA policy that the Pres or Treasurer sign 990. There was major pushback when the issue was brought up- I’ve got the scars and t-shirt ;-PP There are a lot more issues directly related to the ongoing abuse of the title. Most of the current SPEEA board still believes the IRS 990 is simply a form to continue the non profit status of SPEEA. That mantra was started decades ago, and reinforced by Board apathy. However, that form is essentially the same as your 1040 form but for corporations or non profits like unions. It is a public document.

Topic.Title: Mediator hits pause button between BA and SPEEA

Message.Msg: ASK Goforth if HE will forgo his pay and benefits during the probable strike or simply continue his obscene salary, raises, and benefits. ? ASK why the Board gives him so much more in raises each year than the grunts he is supposed to SERVE. 2010 Base salary $ 153,954 pus $ 3440 bonus plus $ 26, 440 in pension/savings plus $ 10,055 in insurance ( non taxable ) and $7,244 in so called expenses. grand total $ 187,917. In reality- his max pension payments s/b 11.5 percent of base pay or $ 17,704. Instead, with staff help and an non attentive E-board, he got about 17 Percent pension goodies or a mere $ 8736 extra somehow. The above numbers are from public information called the IRS 990 ( which board members think is an application to maintain tax exempt status.) ****3 years worth of 990 forms are available at any speea office by anyone- member or not. Just ask. If any stonewalling or #$%$, contact any member of the E-Board for clarification. BTW- GOFORTH has averaged since 2008 an OVER 9% annual increase in his BASE pay- as can be found out in the 990 form for the past years. Simply call or email him directly from a home email and tell him you would like pdf copies of the 3 most recent IRS 990 forms sent to your home email - or use a pseudonym. I'm sure, being the Mensa that he is, and with his so called legal training , he knows the rules. BUT if he objects, or gives you any guff- simply contact the SPEEA Treasurer or any eboard member who can explain things to him. Again NO membership, names, or ID is needed. That way anyone can save a trip to a speea office or avoid mailing or other issues. And there IS a good argument that Goforth does NOT really meet the IRS regs for being a KEY employee. But that is a nit .
